com.berbils.game.entities

Class FireStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.entities.entitytype.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.entities.entitytype.BoxGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.entities.FireStation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FireStation
extends BoxGameEntity
    Creates a fire station body and fixture that the player can interact with through contact
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • StationRepair

        public boolean StationRepair

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireStation

        public FireStation(Vector2 pos,
                   Vector2 sizeDims,
                   java.lang.String textureFilePath,
                   SpriteHandler spriteHandler)
        Creates a Box2D body, fixture and then an attached sprite using the passed in arguments with the appropriate properties for this type of game object
        Parameters:
        pos - The position in meters where the fire station should be created with the center of the fire station being at this position.
        sizeDims - The size of the body,fixture and sprite in meters
        textureFilePath - The file path to the texture for the sprite, * NOTE - If this is null a sprite will * not be created

    • Method Detail

        public void stationDestroyed()
        NEW method @author Alex Dawson Stop repairing the firetrucks when they enter the station and update the texture to the destroyed station

      • canNoLongerEnterFireStat

        public void canNoLongerEnterFireStat()

      • collided

        public void collided(Fixture fixture)
        The method for determining what occurs on collision with the fire station object.The current screen shown is updated and the contacted object is destroyed if it is a fire engine.
        Parameters:
        fixture - The fixture that collided with the object instance
